comments:
I was trying to debug set of plugins on 3.2.RC2 (it was fine on 3.1.2).
Ocasionally, I selected a problem marker in problems view. Then, something
went wrong (probably, an error in one of my selection listeners). Then,
instead of one or two error messages in the ErrorLog, the following
happened:

1) an error dialog "An error has occured. See error log for more details"
was displayed;
2) at the same time, identical error messages were being added to ErrorLog,
one-by-one (until I pressed OK in the dialog (1)).

First (probably, root cause - my problem) message was:

java.lang.LinkageError: Class com/klocwork/inframework/defects/ErrorItem
violates loader constraints
  at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
  ...
  <skip> com.klocwork.inforceui.views.ErrorItemSelectionListener.selectionChanged(ErrorItemSelectionListener.java:43)
  at org.eclipse.ui.internal.AbstractSelectionService.fireSelection(AbstractSelectionService.java:156)
  at org.eclipse.ui.internal.AbstractSelectionService.setActivePart(AbstractSelectionService.java:282)
  ...

And then - 20(not limited) identical messages:

java.lang.RuntimeException: WARNING: Prevented recursive attempt to activate part org.eclipse.pde.runtime.LogView while still in the middle of activating part org.eclipse.ui.views.ProblemView
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.setActivePart(WorkbenchPage.java:3089)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.activate(WorkbenchPage.java:588)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.makeActive(WorkbenchPage.java:1150)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.bringToTop(WorkbenchPage.java:798)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView$20.run(LogView.java:678)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:3325)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2971)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:820)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:796)
	at org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.MessageDialog.openError(MessageDialog.java:322)
tod, over to you just because of the problems view reference. Punt back if you think it should go elsewhere.
This will now be collected in the new error dialog in 3.3.

traces.message: WARNING: Prevented recursive attempt to activate part org.eclipse.pde.runtime.LogView while still in the middle of activating part org.eclipse.ui.views.ProblemView
